required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Topical Ibuprofen for Delayed Onset Mulscle Soreness
clinical_study.official_title: Placebo-controlled, Double-blind Evaluation of the Efficacy and Safety of Ibuprofen 5% Topical Gel for the Treatment of Delayed-onset Muscle Soreness of the Elbow Flexor Muscles

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to compare the efficacy and safety of Ibuprofen 5% Topical Gel versus placebo administered two or three times daily for the treatment of pain associated with delayed onset muscle soreness following intense eccentric exercise of the elbow flexor muscles.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Muscle Soreness with Movement (change from baseline) over 0-24 hours post Dose 1
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, hourly from Hours 1 through 12, and at Hour 24
primary_outcome.description: time weighted Sum of Muscle Soreness with Movement (change from baseline) over 0-24 hours post Dose 1 (SMSM0-24)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the time weighted sum of muscle soreness with movement
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the time weighted sum of muscle soreness with movement over 24-48 hours, 48-72 hours, and 0-72 hours, and the change from baseline in muscle soreness with movement at each assessment time point

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the time weighted sum of spontaneous muscle soreness
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the time weighted sum of spontaneous muscle soreness over 0-24 hours, 24-48 hours, 48-72 hours, and 0-72 hours and the change from baseline in spontaneous muscle soreness at each assessment time point

secondary_outcome.measure: Time weighted sum of muscle soreness relief
secondary_outcome.description: Time weighted sum of muscle soreness relief over 0-24 hours, 24-48 hours, 48-72 hours, and 0-72 hours and the relief score at each assessment time point

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in muscle stiffness
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in muscle stiffness at 24 hours
Subject Global Assessment of Medication at Hour 72

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of doses of rescue medication
secondary_outcome.description: Number of doses of rescue medication

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects taking rescue medication
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects taking rescue medication

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to rescue medication following each dose
secondary_outcome.description: Time to rescue medication following each dose

intervention.description: 10-cm strip of IBU 5% topical gel applied to the affected area BID (twice daily) x 3 days
10-cm strip of placebo topical gel applied to the affected area BID (twice daily) x 3 days
10-cm strip of IBU 5% topical gel applied to the affected area TID (three times daily) x 3 days
10-cm strip of placebo topical gel applied to the affected area TID (three times daily) x 3 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Males or females, 18 to 65 years of age, who have not engaged in upper extremity fitness activities for a minimum of 3 months prior to entry in the study; subjects must be willing to refrain from use of pharmacologic or non pharmacologic treatments (ie, heat, ice, massage) and other forms of soreness relief during the study
Exclusion Criteria:
Use of corticosteroids or short- or long-acting non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs
